qas.question: What type of light is ideal for traffic signals?
In what year were luminescence standards set?
What color LEDs are used when night vision is important?
What is an example of a night vision needed area?
What is another use for one-color light?
What type of light is not ideal for traffic signals?
In what year were non-luminescence standards set?
What color non-LEDs are used when night vision is important?
What is an example of a non-night vision needed area?

context: <a0_0>One-color light<a0_0/> is well suited for traffic lights and signals, <a4_0>exit signs<a4_0/>, emergency vehicle lighting, ships' navigation lights or lanterns (chromacity and luminance standards being set under the Convention on the International Regulations for Preventing Collisions at Sea <a1_0><b6_0>1972<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Annex I and the CIE) and <b5_0>LED<b5_0/>-based Christmas lights. In cold climates, LED traffic lights may remain snow-covered. <a2_0><b7_0>Red or yellow<b7_0/><a2_0/> LEDs are used in indicator and alphanumeric displays in environments where night vision must be retained: aircraft cockpits, <b8_0>submarine<b8_0/> and ship bridges, <a3_0>astronomy observatories<a3_0/>, and in the field, e.g. night time animal watching and military field use.
